intro: Jasione crispa subsp. sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-leaved Jasione, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, sessile leaves and produces small, pink or violet flowers in clusters. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
